intro: Strobilanthes glandibracteata, commonly known as the gland-bract strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. It produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
